text: Canada is a parliamentary democracy that includes ten provinces and three territories. Each province and territory has a head of government. Those people are called Premiers to avoid confusion with the federal Prime Minister. All but five of the Premiers are men. The longest-serving Premier is Dalton McGuinty of Ontario, who has held the position since October 23, 2003; the newest Premier is Pauline Marois of Quebec, who assumed office on September 17, 2012. The oldest premier, Pauline Marois of Quebec, was born in 1949; The youngest Premier, Robert Ghiz of Prince Edward Island, was born in 1974. There are thirteen incumbent Premiers, of which three are from a Liberal Party, three are from a Conservative Party, two are from the New Democratic Party, one is from the Parti Québécois, one is from the Saskatchewan Party, one is from the Yukon Party, and two are non-partisan. ==Current Canadian first ministers== First minister Federation, province, or territory Order Party Incumbency First mandate began Current mandate began Parliament Refer- ences Federation - Prime Minister Justin Trudeau Canada 23rd Liberal 2015 Election 2015 Election 42nd Provinces - Provincial Premiers Kathleen Wynne Ontario 25th Liberal 2013 Designation 2013 Designation 40th Pauline Marois Quebec 30th Parti Québécois 2012 Election 2012 Election 40th Stephen McNeil Nova Scotia 28th Liberal 2013 Election 2013 Election 62nd David Alward New Brunswick 32nd Progressive Conservative 2010 Election 2010 Election 57th Greg Selinger Manitoba 21st New Democratic 2009 Designation 2011 Election 40th Christy Clark British Columbia 35th Liberal 2011 Designation 2011 Designation 39th Robert Ghiz Prince Edward Island 31st Liberal 2007 Election 2011 Election 64th Brad Wall Saskatchewan 14th Saskatchewan Party 2007 Election 2011 Election 27th Alison Redford Alberta 14th Progressive Conservative 2011 Designation 2012 Election 28th Kathy Dunderdale Newfoundland and Labrador 10th Progressive Conservative 2010 Designation 2011 Election 47th Territories - Territorial Premiers Bob McLeod Northwest Territories 12th N/A 2011 Election 2011 Election 17th Darrell Pasloski Yukon 8th Yukon Party 2011 Designation 2011 Election 33rd Eva Aariak Nunavut 2nd N/A 2008 Election 2008 Election 3rd ==References== ==Other websites== * Prime Minister of Canada current Category:Lists of Canadian people Category:Lists of politicians
